items.title: Trump tells Iranians 'help' on the way as reported death toll climbs into thousands
items.description: A human rights agency and an Iranian official both say around 2,000 people have been killed in protests against the country's ruling Islamic regime.

items.title: 'Moscow on the Torrens': How to lose a writers' week in six days
items.description: The removal and subsequent handling of Randa Abdel-Fattah's rescinded invitation to Adelaide Writers' Week led to the event's cancellation, with more than 180 authors pulling out and its own director issuing a pointed and very public resignation. Where does the festival go from here?

items.title: Louise Adler unloads over reputationally 'trashed' Adelaide Writers' Week
items.description: The former Adelaide Writers' Week director takes aim at lobby groups and the SA premier during an intense appearance on 7.30 in which she says the event's reputation has been "trashed".

items.title: Victoria's bushfires more than five times the size of Singapore
items.description: Victoria's bushfires have now burnt across 404,000 hectares, or a total area more than five times the size of Singapore.

items.title: Deported Melbourne tobacco kingpin Kazem Hamad arrested in Iraq
items.description: Iraqi authorities have confirmed the convicted heroin trafficker and illegal tobacco boss has been arrested for alleged drug importation and smuggling.

items.title: The man cops overlooked in Eloise Worledge disappearance
items.description: As police up the reward to $1 million for information that will lead to the remains of missing school girl Eloise Worledge, questions remain about why police disregarded a known rapist in their investigation.

items.title: Indian truckies fed up with racist tirades over their CB radios
items.description: Some Indian truck drivers have copped so much racist abuse they have stopped using their CB radios.

items.title: How Trump's White House is trying to run Venezuela through one woman
items.description: Venezuela is in the hands of both President Trump and a regime loyal to its ousted leader. The country's future, including the well-being of its people, is likely to depend on how well Delcy Rodríguez can walk a tightrope between Washington's demands and her coalition's hard-liners.

items.title: Survey demonstrates growing concern among parents about cost of education
items.description: From second-hand uniform shops, saving plans and making tough decisions, here's what some families are doing to keep the costs associated with education down.

items.title: Russia's 'unstoppable' nuclear-capable missile sparks emergency UN meeting
items.description: Analysts say Russia's new Oreshnik hypersonic missile will continues to pose challenges for NATO after Moscow used the weapon for a second time in Ukraine.

items.title: Gunmen used this Bondi Beach footbridge. What should be done with it now?
items.description: The Bondi Beach footbridge that some locals want removed following last month's terror attack was already going to need replacement for structural reasons, it can be revealed.

items.title: Bullock joins global bankers' defence of US Fed chief facing Trump probe
items.description: Twelve central bankers, including Australia's Reserve Bank governor Michele Bullock, have signed a letter in support of Mr Powell, who is set to face a criminal investigation in the US.

items.title: Brisbane neurosurgeon charged over alleged medical devices kickback scheme
items.description: The ABC can reveal a neurosurgeon specialising in spinal surgery is among five people facing serious charges over a Queensland scheme allegedly involving kickbacks for medical devices.

items.title: Smoke lifts from western Victorian town, revealing saves and losses
items.description: The Natimuk community counts its losses after fire tears through the region, destroying properties, businesses and about 30 homes.

items.title: Survival tales from flood-hit Clermont as ex-TC Koji recovery begins
items.description: Families in the central Queensland community of Clermont describe the moment they escaped swiftly rising floodwaters triggered by ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji.

items.title: Are your donations helping or hindering op shops?
items.description: Op shops ask people to be mindful of what they donate following an influx of donations over the new year.

items.title: Easy ways to reduce your exposure to microplastics at home
items.description: Researchers say there are some simple ways to help minimise our exposure to the microplastics and nanoplastics in our homes.

items.title: Sharp rebuke over 'strange' review of mountain management
items.description: Loved by bushwalkers and tourists, a sacred Aboriginal site, and with weather conditions that can quickly deteriorate, Hobart's Kunanyi/Mount Wellington is a challenge to manage — and a government review of how that is done is being met with concerns.

items.title: Live: ASX to slip in early trade as Wall Street pulls back from record high
items.description: The Australian share market is likely to open slightly lower after Wall Street's retreat, while central bank chiefs across the world have issued a joint statement in support of US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell, whom Donald Trump continues to hurl insults at. Follow live.

items.title: Clintons refuse to testify for US House Epstein investigation
items.description: Republicans in the US House say they could commence contempt of Congress proceedings against the former president and former Democratic presidential nominee.

items.title: 'We don't want them': Neo-Nazi group says it will disband ahead of new laws
items.description: In a statement posted to Telegram, the group announced the closure of the National Socialist Network would also spell the end of "co-projects" White Australia, the European Australian Movement and the White Australia Party.

items.title: Prosecutors seek death penalty for ex-South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol
items.description: Yoon Suk Yeol faces several criminal charges related to his call to impose martial law and other criminal cases related to his time in office.

items.title: Australian Open 2026: When the tournament starts and the stars to watch
items.description: With the 2026 Australian Open just around the corner here's everything you need to know about the tournament.

items.title: Aussies roar in Adelaide as former Aus Open finalist continues slide
items.description: Australians Aleksandar Vukic and Rinky Hijikata join Thanasi Kokkinakis in the men's last 16 in Adelaide, while Stefanos Tstisipas slide continues.

items.title: Aussie released by battling F1 team in 'mutual decision'
items.description: Alpine and Australian Jack Doohan agree to part ways so the 22-year-old driver can "pursue other career opportunities".
